Here is the call graph for this function:

bool Solver::solveCell (  Cell &  cell,
Line &  row,
Line &  col,
Box &  box
)  throw (domain_error, logic_error) [static, private]
 

Resolve and set the final state of cell if possible, or at least eliminate some possibilities.

After performing the solving operation, this function automatically updates the row, column and box where it resides.

  • cell reference to the cell to solve
  • row reference to the row in which the cell resides
  • col reference to the column in which the cell resides
  • box reference to the box in which the cell resides
    Returns:
    true if the any kind of success happened, or false otherwise
    Exceptions:
    logic_error Thrown if no possibility is left in any of the cells or if
    domain_error Thrown if cell is already set and it's attempted to set it to a different value
